One final down, two to go - heck yes, school is almost over.  The last few days have been of the more interesting variety, primarily spent disassembling my laptop to remove the soda I spilled on it, studying for finals, and more thought on social dilemmas.  People are quite an interesting species; unmatched not only in intellect and genius, but also in our sheer illogical thought processes.  Our brains are but neurons and chemicals, and yet from a self-organized network of connections comes the most amazing computer ever known.  Of course, Descartes would disagree with the last statement, as will a significant portion of my readership.  Ah well, good topic for discussion, I suppose.

With the many situations developing in my life recently, Christmas break should be an interesting diversion from the monotony of normal life.  Given the sensitive nature of most of the situations, I suppose I will abstain from writing on it all now.  I also am doing a major project for ICS, integrating a few servers and attempting to create a working prototype of our final product.  Finally, given the multitude of friends I've promised to visit over the break, I imagine I'll manage to stay busy, even without school.

In conclusion, I recommend everyone goes out and reads "Who Moved My Cheese?" right now.  Nikkie recommended the book to me, and I must say it's quite a nice read.  It's very short and to the point (I managed to read it in about an hour over her house), but everyone can learn something about dealing with change from it.

Today is mine and Justin's six month anniversary! I'm so happy that we've made it this long, through all the hard times that we've had. He's stuck with me through many times that I was surprised that he even wanted to stay with me for. He's been more faithful to me than anyone in the past has ever been to me. He never lets me doubt that he loves me. He never lets me lose my confidence in myself. He keeps me accountable. He and I are able to pray together in order to keep our relationship with God as a part of our relationship. We're able to talk about spiritual things and try to see each other's views on them. We are so similar in many ways, but are also so different that it makes our relationship interesting. He takes care of me. He gives me everything that I could have wanted in a relationship. I'm so thankful that God put us together, my life has been truly blessed by Justin.

We're not able to be together today, which makes this anniversary a little more sad than the others. Six months is a big deal to both of us and I wish that I could see him, but I know I can't. We'll just see each other all weekend (as we normally do) and celebrate our anniversary then. 

I would have never seen myself dating Justin when we first met! We were so different that I thought of him as just some random guy that I was in a band with. After I had been in the band for a while, he and I started talking online and becoming friends. Pretty soon, he was one of my good friends and a person that I could confide in about a lot of things. At the end of April was when things started to change (for those of you who read LiveJournal at that time, you know what I'm talking about because I know some of you read the entries that we wrote while he was at my house). I started seeing him differently, as someone that maybe I could see myself with. We had our first date on May 2 after talking about the feelings we were starting to have for each other. I became his girlfriend on May 18th and that was one of the best decisions I've made this year! I was afraid that we would break up when we left for college, but that didn't happen. We're now closer than we were before we left for college and our relationship just keeps getting stronger everyday. I didn't know at first why God was putting Justin in my life, but now I realize that He did it to show me what love really is and how a relationship should work.

I really do love him so much and I'm so glad that he's in my life. I love you, my geek :-*  Happy six month!

Today is the six month anniversary of when Katie and I became boyfriend and girlfriend.  Though I suppose to some people, this means nothing, I must say it marks the best six months of my life thus far, and therefore it's meaningful to me.  Katie has always been there for me, being one of the nicest, sweetest people I know.  She's also let me be there for her, opening up to me about everything; trusting completely, just as a relationship should be.  I wish it were possible to see her today, even if I could just have taken her out to dinner.  She deserves more than a dinner on this occasion, but the closest she'll get to seeing me today is through a webcam.

I'm truly blessed in so many ways.  I'm blessed to have the best girlfriend in the world (yeah, yeah, I know everyone says that... but mine really is ;)).  I'm blessed to have found someone so kind and loving.  I'm blessed to be in a stable relationship; not void of disagreements, but lacking the uncertainty that plagues so many people our age.  I'm blessed to have found someone who generally shares my beliefs on God and religion (except for women pastors and predestination... *cough*).  Most of all, I'm blessed to love someone that reciprocates that love.

Happy six months, my love :-*

Since Justin and I apparently never update, I'll update to prove that statement wrong ;) Justin has been crazy busy lately, like me, with school and other such things. He and I have been lucky enough to be able to see each other every weekend since I've been away at college (the only one we didn't get to see each other was the one where he moved into Tech and I was getting ready to move into NGCSU, but that's the only one other than that). I didn't think that we were going to be able to see each other but once every two weeks and Justin told me that he thought we'd see each other more than that... I'll admit it, I was wrong and he was right... thank goodness he was right! I think that the old saying is true... "Absence makes the heart grow fonder." I really believe that, the distance doesn't make me love him any less, if anything it makes me even more grateful for the time that we get to spend together. He's such a blessing in my life and I'm glad he's such a big part of my life. He and I get to talk a couple of times a day on the phone, send each other text messages all day long, talk online, and he talks to me every night before I go to bed. Even though we don't get to see each other every day like we pretty much did this summer, we're in constant communication during the weekdays. 
      I'll update about what we did this weekend because I don't think I can really remember all the places we've been since we (and by "we" I mean "I") updated his journal last. Yesterday, we went to The Varsity for dinner and then to Tech for a while. It was great being able to just talk to him and see him. He picked me some flowers too, which was just an adorable thing to do :) Then he and I came back to my house and he stayed here for a while before he had to go home. Today, he came to my house and we stayed here for a while this afternoon, where I proceeded to make him watch Gilmore Girls in agreement that I would watch two episodes of one of his favorite shows for making him suffer like he says that I did. Oh, today was our five month anniversary, which is so nice! I'm glad that we're making it, even though we have distance between us for most of the week... on the weekends we're inseparable :) Anyway, so we left my house and went to Applebee's on the way to Steph's grandma's house to celebrate Steph's 19th birthday. We decided not to eat until after the party so we went shoe shopping for me so I could have some brown shoes to take back to NGCSU with me since it's getting cold. He was a little annoyed because I found some shoes I liked but went to three other shoes before coming back 45 minutes later to the first pair I saw and buying them ;) He got over his initial bitterness once we arrived at the birthday party after taking a few wrong turns (::ahem:: I told him the right way to go but he didn't think it was and it turned out to be right ::ahem::). We stayed for a while before going to City Cafe Diner, where we were the only people in the place for a while which was creepy. Then we went to Conyers to get a Blockbuster rental card for the two of us, since we always watch movies on the weekend and we're running out of stuff to watch! The guy who helped us get the card was really funny and made fun of Justin's lack of handwriting skills, for all who care. I was rolling for about ten minutes while he was filling out the paperwork and making fun of Justin's penmanship (apparently, Justin was born in 1705 instead of 1985). Then we came back here before he had to leave and meet his friend. Tomorrow should be fun... he's coming to pick me up and take me back to NGCSU because my BSU is doing something for Gold Rush Days and I have to be there and wanted Justin there.
      Well, to end off this loverly (yes I spelled it wrong on purpose) entry, I will now include a little sappy stuff that nobody wants to read! I figured that I would save it for the end so nobody that didn't want to would be forced to read it ;) I'm so glad that God put Justin in my life. Justin said the sweetest thing tonight... he was praying for our meal and thanked God for putting us together. Then he told me after he prayed that it was God that put us together because I wasn't the type of girl that he'd normally date. Yes, that may seem odd to someone and not so sweet to others, but it was sweet to me. It made me feel good that he was acknowledging that God had put us together and that there's a reason for us being together. He's been a big blessing in my life and I'm thankful for him daily. He's my boyfriend and my best friend. I know he'll do anything for me and I'll do anything for him. I'm looking forward to seeing what God has in store for us, I think it's something great. I'm just trusting God with what he wants for me and Justin :) So... Justin, I love you more than anything in the whole wide world and I'm grateful for you, geek :-*

Since Justin never updates, I'll step in once again and do the job for him so you can all be informed as to what's going on in Justin's life. On Friday night he went to Six Flags and had a good time there. He told me all about it when he called me and woke me up at 1 AM when he got home ;) It was ok for him to do that though because I told him he could. On Saturday he came to pick me up early (by early I mean 10 which is early for a Saturday morning) so we could go to the Yellow Daisy Festival. We stopped to get gas and got him breakfast at Chick-fil-a on the way to the park. Traffic was horrendous as expected, we didn't really leave at an early enough time but that wasn't my fault (::ahem:: Justin's fault, but I didn't say that!). The Yellow Daisy Festival was actually really nice. We walked in and Justin said that he'd never felt more out of place somewhere just because of the crowd and the environment. Basically, it was crafty (and some cool artsy stuff thank you very much)and... we were a weird age, older than the kids who's parents dragged but younger than the parents who wanted to come... so we were the only teenagers there of their own free will (well I was there out of my own free will and Justin claims that I dragged him there which is somewhat accurate). It was still fun though and I know he had a good time after he got used to it. It was so nice and relaxing, we just walked around the festival with our arms around each other, enjoying each other's company. It was really sweet... and he bought me a blue ring there which is pretty and I've worn it everyday since then... he's sweet to me :) We went to Blimpie's after that for lunch before we headed to Tech. Wow, Tech. That was pure insanity right there. All the fans there for the Tech/Auburn game were insane! It was madness! Have I emphasized enough that it was pretty crazy? Well, Tech won which was awesome and that excited me... and Justin obviously. The only bad thing about Saturday was the fact that he found out that something happened the night before, I'll let him update about that if he cares to. Since he was unhappy about his unfortunate revelation, we went to The Varsity and I bought his dinner :) I like being able to do stuff like that! Then he and I went back to my house and watched the old Music Man again because it's so good. We finished watching the rest of it yesterday, but that's coming up later. On Sunday he came to Logan's Roadhouse to pick me up after I got finished with eating lunch with my family and a church friend. He and I went shopping after that for a cable to put on laptop's so they won't get stolen (I still can't figure out how to put mine on but oh well). I then dragged him to Old Navy to get me a new purse since mine broke. He was very patient with me and I appreciated that :) We went back to my house after that and finished watching the Music Man. Butch's parents came over for a while so we talked to them before packing his car with my stuff. He and I got all my stuff in his car and we started driving to Lauren's house so she could take me back up here. He and I went to eat dinner, then we went to Lauren's house. He stayed until we had to leave. It gets harder and harder for me to leave him every time. Seeing him drive off right before we did was really hard, I don't know why it gets so difficult sometimes. I wish that I were closer to him sometimes, but I realize that God has us apart right now for a reason. And I treasure the time we do get to spend together when we see each other so that makes those rare times more special. I miss him today and I love him :)

Quite a bit has happened since my last post, most of which will never find its way into the hallowed halls of The Live Journal. My first week of classes ended well, with little (or, more exactly, no) trouble at all. In fact, I've already completed all homework due until Friday (I'm such a nerd). Political Science is still great, and English/CS/Calc are there. I missd PSYC 1000 yesterday... thought it was at 2, turns out it was at 1. When I arrived, I found myself at the mercy of a class full of management majors... scary stuff ;) Anyway, Katie came to visit on Sunday, which was incredibly nice. She already updateded about that in here though, so I'll just leave it at that.

I know that I have my own journal, but I still wanted to make a quick update on Justin's :) I had forgotten how fun it was to take over his journal to make an entry! So anyway, I was able to see Justin on Sunday. He picked me up at a gas station where my family met him after driving me all the way to Tucker from Dahlonega. When I saw his car pull up in the parking lot, all I could do was smile and scramble to get out of the car. If you haven't seen someone that means that much to you in ten days, you get very excited about it :) I didn't think I would be able to see him until this weekend but it worked out for me to see him last weekend too! He and I went to Tech where he showed me around campus some before we went to eat at the Student Center. He showed me around the campus some more and we just stayed there for a while. Spending time with him was so nice and much needed. He and I stopped to get some food on the way home to take back to my house. He and I ate while watching Chicago... good movie. Then we went to visit my grandma (Nanu) for a few minutes before coming back to my house. He had to leave pretty soon after we got back to my house and I didn't like that one bit. I think it gets harder and harder for me to have him leave each time he does it. I feel like seeing him on Sunday made our relationship even stronger. Just some of the stuff we talked about made me trust him even more than I already do and made me realize how strong our relationship is. 

I get to see him in two days :) I'm coming home for Labor Day weekend and I get to see him on Friday, Saturday, and possibly another day in there somewhere! I can't wait. Yes I just saw him a few days ago, but I still want to see him again and am just as excited as I was the last time to see him :) He's the greatest and I'm thankful for my best friend/boyfriend that I miss and love :) I love doing sappy things like that every once in a while!

ah, now I remember what "study music" is :)  Though, to be truthful, I've really not had much studying thus far.  I went to my first CS class yesterday, since I skipped my lecture/recitation earlier in the week.  I was so completely bored I ended up creating some artwork... I'll try to scan it in and put it on here sometime.  Calc is still dumb, but I'm sure it'll get more interesting sometime.  Ah, oh well... so far, POLS 1101 is my favorite class.  How sad, a math major preferring a humanities class (note: I still like math and computers more, the classes are just extremely boring).

I get to see Katie on Sunday... I can't wait :)  I haven't seen her for over a week, the most since she went to Alaska.  Then I get to see her over Labor Day weekend too... that should all be good.  I'll be able to hang out with some old friends tonight at the final On The Bricks, featuring the Goo Goo Dolls.  Ahh... good times.

Here I am again, 3:42 in the morning, though this time I graced the Student Center with my presence.  Needless to say, all the sane people have been sleeping for hours, whilst I finished all my homework assignments from today.  In addition to this, I finished the first phase of a project for ICS tonight, which mostly consisted of shuffling data amongst several spreadsheets.  In theory, I'll finish a Gantt chart tomorrow, which will represent inventory at a warehouse in DC for a certain well-known-but-I'm-not-sure-I-should-write-it-here retail chain.  Ah well...

Classes went well yesterday.  My college career commenced with a 12:00 lecture in Political Science 1101.  The class should be fairly entertaining, and the teacher won bonus points for mocking both major political parties within 15 minutes.  In the class, we will set up our own congress, and each person will create a bill and attempt to get it passed.  We must also write an argumentative essay, roughly in the style of an editorial, on some topic (preferably it should be arguing for your bill to get passed).

English lasted all of 15 minutes today, with our only assignment to create a WebX account and read a little 16-page something.  The theme for the class is nuclear arms... heck yeah... this is my kinda english :)

Calc was... Algebra.  We reviewed inequalities mostly.  We should be dealing with calculus by next week, though.  I just finished my 30-or-so math problems that were assigned as homework.  For some reason, I'm strangely motivated to do schoolwork here, something I've never quite felt before.  Perhaps it's the constant reminding that "Tech is harder than High School", but I think it's something more than that.  I think the environment itself fosters a sense of learning and a desire to succeed.  My High School studying consisted primarily of grabbing a bite at Chick-Fil-A before a test, and maybe skimming through the book... depending on how much I was in the mood for CFA.  Ah well, 'tis all for the better I suppose.

In slightly less academic news, Katie and I have been dating for three months as of yesterday.  I miss her, but realize it's only temporary and that I will see her eventually, though it'd certainly have been nice to see her yesterday.  I become more convinced every day that it wasn't a mistake to stay together in college.  She starts classes today... I'm quite positive she'll do fine (I mean, she has to be smarter than the military guys... and she probably is smarter than most of the girls there too).  I keep meeting new people here at Tech as well, which adds a nice break from studies.  Just tonight, I finally met someone with whom I've spoken for quite some time.  I keep attempting not to shun my old friends, though it's quite difficult at times.  I'll probably try to get a lot of us together this Friday to go see the Goo Goo Dolls down at On The Bricks.

Anyway... I ought to get some rest before my 1:00 class tomorrow (oh yeah, my schedule rocks).  CS starts tomorrow night as well, which should prove interesting.  Anyway... g'morning all.

As I figured, I haven't been able to update as frequently as my pre-college years.  I'm presently in the Library West Commons at 3:16 in the morning, primarily to avoid waking my roommate with my nocturnal patterns.  I shant bore you with the mundane details of my day, as there were merely a few highlights worthy of mention.

First, I stopped by a fraternity today... not just any frat, but a Jewish frat :)  Amazingly, I finally met another discrete math major there, and we talked for about an hour.  We played Egyptian Ratscrew/Chinese Whore (depending on whom you ask) again, and I actually set up an excel spreadsheet to keep track of winnings throughout the semester.

Through the hustle and bustle of the season, I've managed to make a few personal contacts... I'm rather surprised at my level of social interaction over the last few days.  Mind you, I have done more than merely partying... I've actually gone through a bit of CS and Calc, and managed to procure all my books for the semester, aside from English.

Tomorrow (today, I suppose) marks my first day of classes... it's strange, but I cannot say I feel homesick in the least.  In fact, I'm inclined to say I feel more at home here than anywhere else.  The one major detraction of Tech is that Katie isn't here.  She moved in to N Ga today, and ended up having a fine time (I told her there was nothing to worry about).  In fact, that's probably the only thing I could complain about here, the lack of Katie.  We talked on the phone tonight, where I found out some, ahem, interesting activities they have planned for tomorrow.  Ah well, I trust her... if there's no trust, there's really no relationship.  Especially when she's an hour away, and I have no way of really knowing what she's doing other than what she says.

Stuart also called me tonight, needing something done by tomorrow.  Splendid... I spent an hour or two earlier this morning figuring out Gantt charts in Excel.  He's suppose to email me sometime this morning, detailing some preliminary work for me, and then call at 10:00, to discuss putting the data in presentable form for the execs.

Anyway... classes start in 8.5 hours.  Wish me luck.

well, I finally moved in to the dorm here at Tech. I don't expect to update as much or in as much detail, probably just when something interesting or notable happens. Some general observations so far are that most guys here are desperate, and make themselves look like fools chasing girls, and that the buzz card is awesome. I'll be getting lots of excersize here, even if I never set foot in the SAC. Anyway, Katie got an LJ tonight too... mykatiebug. I must say, I absolutely love it here at Tech, though. Despite the dominate Y chromosome, the people here are really friendly and intelligent. My roommate is a fairly quiet guy, I don't think he'll give me any problems (nor I him, I hope). I've met quite a few friends, so I'm not terribly isolated here. My dorm is larger than I expected, not crowded at all, in fact... I could put my couch in here quite comfortably. The only part I don't like about Tech is being away from Katie; I can't wait to see her in a few weeks. I took seeing her all the time for granted this summer, and now I won't much at all. But at least life here is great... Tech is really a perfect fit for me.

well I've seen a thousand things in one place

but I stopped my counting when I saw your face

erasing memory I feel as though I've never seen a face before 

until I saw your eyes smiling back at me through my tears

I've been counting all these years

Now suddenly the thousand things I've seen were 

nothing more than dreams of you and me


I know that was sappy, but oh well :) Justin moved into Tech yesterday and I miss him :) Only about two more weeks until I get to see him :)

Geek... I know I know, that's an odd term of affection for someone... but mine is Bug so what else would you expect but something equally weird? Justin just left a few minutes ago, it gets harder and harder to see him go. Now I realize that sounds weird and sappy but let me explain myself :) Justin moves into Tech on Thursday and I move into NGCSU on Sunday. He and I don't get to see each other for a couple of weeks after Wednesday. So that's why it gets harder for me to watch him go because I know that I'll only see him one or two more times before we don't see each other for a couple of weeks. Enough of the sappiness... onto details of stuff that's been going on that might actually interest someone :) I have officially seen Justin for the past four days straight... it's been nice. He came to my house on Thursday and we went to Wendy's before practicing for tonight. He, Jason, Corey, and I were playing at Tucker First Baptist tonight. More on that later ;) So we ate supper then went to the church as the church band had practice before us. As Justin was running sound, I was kept entertained by this precious little girl that was there... I mean, this kid was so cute! Anyway, so practice went well then Jason, Justin, and I went to get a quick bite to eat (I'm always hungry) before my family came to get me. Friday, Justin came over and he and I watched Fools Rush In because my friend Ashley left the movie at my house. Then he and I went to eat before heading to his house to pick Jason up. When we got Jason, we went to On The Bricks to see Tonic and Hootie and the Blowfish. Tonic was really really good... and of course Hootie was great (I love them!)! He and I went to Waffle House with Clay, Jason, and Dustin to eat after the concert (as I said before, I'm always hungry) which was nice. Then I went home :) Yesterday, Justin came over and we went to practice again at TFBC. Practice didn't go very well, to say the least. We went out to dinner with Jason, Dustin, and Rachel. After dinner, we went to a video store and rented Heartbreakers. I know that's a random movie and a few years old, but it's so funny. I was glad that they liked it because I hate recommending movies that people just wind up disliking! Then Jason took Rachel home and Dustin went home... Justin left later after he and I talked for a while. Today was church and lunch at different places for both of us... then we met up at the church. After setting up and practicing, we did the show. That went pretty well, for being thrown together in just two days. Justin, Rachel, Dustin, Jason, and I went to dinner after the concert. Justin and I came back here and watched a movie. Then he and I sat in the computer room and just talked. It was so nice, he and I are getting closer and closer to each other. He truly is my best friend and I do love him. I know that's sappy and nobody probably cares but him, but I do love him. I'm thankful for him daily. Well, I hope I get to update his journal before we both leave for college. If not, I'll talk to you LiveJournal folk in a few weeks or so :)

My relatives left tonight, after 5 days of visiting.  It's always enjoyable to spend time with them, never a dull moment.  Saturday, we ate Thai (yes, even I sampled some shrimp and some weird sauce... I was pleasantly suprised that I enjoyed it), and then came back to the house to play Blurt.

Sunday, we drove out to Montgomery to see cousin Becky at Maxwell AFB.  Never been on a military base before, it was quite interesting.  What was really cool was seeing her get saluted by the guard as we entered... she's been in the Air Force 3 weeks and is already a 2ed Lieutenant.  I guess they treat doctors well :)  Anyway, I drove almost the entire way there, and the entire way back... about 300 miles.

Today, I mostly researched stock Options, and how to trade them.  I think I will start investing in that, just to see what I can do.  Anyway, my cousins came over for the final dinner tonight, then we played Blurt again.  They drive back to New York tomorrow... anyway, that's all.  G'night.

'tis the title of my vocal performance in my final Mustard Seed show last night (a rare combination of Hendrix's Purple Haze, and the lyrics to Amazing Grace). The entire story, however, really begins a long long time ago (that would be Thursday), far far away (approximately 5 miles), in a little section of town built around Euclid and Moreland, generally referred to as "Little 5 Points". This section of the city caters to, shall we say, a very "interesting" group of people - not exactly my customary hangout. My relatives from New York happen to be in town, so cousin Sarah, Jason, and I trek the 10 minute drive down to Little 5 Points, walk around, venture into several stores, merely to discover the pricing to be detestable. Following that, the three of us journeyed Starbucks, and then the Salvation Army off Marietta St. There, I purchased a shirt for the concert for $2.99... God bless the Salvation Army. We ate at Felini's, and then went back to my house to futilely attempt to coerce Jason and Mom into watching Run, Lola, Run, a German flick representing three possible outcomes of a certain 20-minute timespan (note: Sarah and I had previously seen it). Katie and I met up early on Friday, and spent most of the day together. At her house, I had the distinct "pleasure" of viewing Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure. Aside from Dude, Where's My Car, I don't believe such a loathsome work of film exists. The only remotely humorous parts involved mispronunciations of historical figures, but, alas, a movie can only use that so many times. Perhaps the most annoying quality was the characteristic "dude-speak"... again, how frequently can the same idiosyncrasy be used and still have comedic value? We (by which I mean Katie and me) arrived at Faith Community Church in Grayson (the venue for this particular performance) at approximately 6:00, 1.5 hours preceeding the opening song. I personally think the show went well, though various band members have differing opinions. Katie was outstanding, particularly in the songs with just her and me. I did fairly well, with room for improvement... but Amazing Haze and I'm So Afraid (my main two songs) were excellent, I think. Anyway, Dustin was kind enough to tape the show on my camera, so I've posted some of the better songs on my website at http://caffeinehigh.net/narf/FaithCommunity/. The interaction on stage was good too, especially between Katie and me (imagine that... almost like we enjoyed looking at each other :)). I attempted to appear a bit more lively tonight than in previous shows, seeing as that's often noted as something on which we need improvement. At some point during the concert, I whispered into Katie's ear that I loved her... I think she liked that :) I was glad to see Natty and Isaiah were able to come as well... Isaiah and I spoke for about 30 minutes about economics and forign policy after the concert. Afterward, Katie, Dustin, Corey, Jenn, and I went to Steak 'n Shake for a post-concert dinner, then Dustin brought me home.

Freshmen Orientation at Ga Tech was last Sunday/Monday... I don't think I've ever been surrounded by so many people who could actually conduct an intelligent conversation :)  I skipped most of the sessions, as they were completely pointless (particularly if one had previously attended Connect With Tech), and just exploring campus/meeting some people/eating better meals than the ones provided.  Unlike Connect With Tech, I actually socialized a fair amount, getting a few email addresses, and staying out until 3:00 on Monday morning (I don't think my roommate was pleased when I woke him after he'd be sleeping a while).

Most of my time was spent with Patricia, Courtney, and Alex, speaking with the latter two for almost 4 hours Sunday night/Monday morning.  The conversation was actually fairly deep and certainly intelligent... not bad for people I randomly met a few hours before.  Coincidentally, Alex was the only other Math major there, but we didn't know this until only the two of us showed up at the Math adviser.  Anyway, I'm completely convinced Tech is absolutely perfect for me... from the social scene, to the urban environment, to the challenging classes; I will love it.

I basically expected another fiscally responsible how-to guide with the typical "invest early", "mutual funds are your friend", and, of course "the wonders of compound interest"; however, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it challenged many common ideas pertaining to money. First, money isn't real... of course, we all know this (or at least, anyone who has attended an economics class). Money used to be backed by various standards (gold, silver, etc...) which meant that for each paper dollar you had, there was actual gold or silver that it represented. Now, however, money has no value other than what we agree it to be... the book didn't actually even get into much detail other that saying money isn't real... I just kinda felt like extrapolating on it :) It also challenges assumptions like your car/house are assets, risk is bad, and that you should work for money. The point of the book was making you understand that money should work for you, not that you should work for it. The one rule he leaves you with is, basically, but assets, not liabilities (along with generally increasing financial intelligence). Seems simple enough, problem is knowing what is what :) Anyway, I highly recommend this book... especially at a young age, understanding these principles will serve you well later in life. Evidentially he is somewhat well known in certain social circles, mostly for his work in Caedmon's Call (which I have heard of), which I assume he recently left to pursue a solo career. I really agreed with most of what he was saying, and though he wasn't explicit, I picked up on references to some popular books like the Left Behind series and the Prayer of Jabez.  Anyway... in conclusion... don't commercialize religion ;)
